website_summaries.verdict: A high-quality set of strings that is both long-lasting and very smooth to play.
pros: Choice of several gauges, from extra light to medium, as well as a variety of coatings
Constructed of 80/20 (80% copper, 20% zinc) bronze-wrapped wire
cons: Some felt that these strings were too bright
Reports of the coating ripping off after a period of time
The G string is not as durable as other strings in the set

customer_reviews.title: Strings Sound Dull
customer_reviews.text: First time buyer. My local luthier says Elixir is the best string available and I thought with all the five star reviews on Amazon these would be the best I could find anywhere. Well, I don't like the sound one little bit! They sound like old ready-to-be-changed strings. They are dull, they do not 'ring-on' like I would expect high-end string to ring. Only reason I give two stars is because I do like the physical feel; they are much kinder to the fingers and moving from one note to another is smooth and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Oakman

customer_reviews.title: NIGHT and DAY difference from other strings.  BEAUTIFUL sound.
customer_reviews.text: Best strings for acoustic. The lush sound reminds me of listening to Robert Goulet play piano. The first time I set up my Martin with these strings and gave it a quick strum, my wife turned her head around and said "what was THAT?". The difference between this and other strings I've used is night and day. And the bonus is, these strings last a LONG time, and that's great because I don't change mine nearly often enough. I signed up for the subscribe & save because I want to be reminded when to change them.
customer_reviews.author: BroBryce

customer_reviews.title: It's durable and clean looking
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. I decided to try it out because my favorite Independent band, Boyce Avenue, uses the brand and their guitar sounds so nice live. Anyway, they're durable and lasts long. However, the strings are kind of hard to press compared to the usual strings that I use. Also, I don't like how it eliminates the squeeky noise when sliding chords and whatnot--makes me feel like I have a silent guitar. The tone is nice and balanced, but not quite bright in my ears. Still giving it a 5 though because they're very durable and clean looking compared to the ones I usually use, which after about 5 days of heavy duty usage it turns to a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Love the sound!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the sound of these strings. Been playing for about a year fingerstyle acoustic and these sound the best by far. They offer a bright almost whiny tone, very loud and vibrant, easy to hammer on/pull off. Subtle movements on the fret board can be heard that many other strings can't replicate. Up until now my favorite have been D'Addario coated philosopher bronze which are amazing also, but the sound with the elixer is unmatched. My only criticism is one of the strings coating appeared to be separating after only a few days of play. Only on one string, I feel it may have been a random defect. Easy 4 star, 5 if not the coating issue.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Weak design
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been playing guitar for over ten years and have restringed many times. The durability on these strings are not good. It snapped during install. I tried this brand because they are said to be smoother and brighter but I can’t even get to the point of playing. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Strings and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Modified my review, these strings are actually fantastic, and have great durability and tone. I love that they can take a real beating without starting to wear out and get dull. While they are more expensive than regular strings, they are worth it. The quality and durability are unbeatable and for someone who has very sweaty hands, the coating does a great job of keeping your strings clean and sounding great without becoming dull from the acidic sweat. Use only elixir on both my electrics and acoustics, took me years of using cheap $5-$8 string sets before I tried elixirs and instantly found out why people swear by them.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Best strings money can buy!
customer_reviews.text: These strings make your guitar sing bright & balanced. They also hold up to the testament of time, and are worth every penny. I only change my strings once a year, and can honestly say I could probably go longer. The coating on the strings does tend to start to show at some point where there is heavy picking involved... though it doesn’t really effect the playability or sound brilliance. Overall these are my go-to strings for acoustic guitars and I haven’t found another brand that comes close to offering the same sound quality, durability, and value that Elixir provide.
customer_reviews.author: John Kegel

customer_reviews.title: Rich and bright sound long lasting strings!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a set of elixir strings and received a wrong set but amazon refund me andsend me the new set Overall elixir strings are the best in the market hands down The sound is so rich and bright The technology that they use in their Nanoweb strings is so great that i can keep my guitar tuned for weeks using my guitar almost everyday I was using other brands and when I switched to elixir strings that a good friend of mine recommended i was able to tell the difference in the first strum I really recommend this set
customer_reviews.author: Juan D.

customer_reviews.title: skip it unless you love them already
customer_reviews.text: I usually use Martin Marquis strings. I bought these because I do not play a lot of acoustic guitar and I figured a set that I don't use much could be a most costly set and I would get more value out of them. Stringing them up everything is fine. Tuning everything is fine. Playing a couple tunes the coating is already coming off. I've got a nice acoustic that I'm almost half afraid to play hard on...so it's not a case of abuse or anything. Either this pack is defective or the coating flakes up and the strings sound awful without much play. Either way, I should've bought two packs of martin marquis instead of one pack of these.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic strings
customer_reviews.text: Amazing durability! I'm a casual player and usually play daily. Most people like me tend not to change strings very often, and with the Elixers you can play MUCH longer before you are forced to replace them. I would say they have at least 2-3 times the life of your average acoustic strings. I'm especially impressed with how they respond to aggressive bending--I have only broken a .012 once, and that was after four months! Well worth the price and I never will buy anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bodine

customer_reviews.title: They still last for ages, and still have great tone
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite brand of strings for acoustic! They sound amazing and last ages. I've recently switched to extra light strings of the same brand, which I prefer, but I only have good things to say! Elixer strings last me ages! I'm not super picky, but I play a moderate amount and often hit the strings pretty hard (although I probably only put in about 30 minutes to an hour a day average on my acoustics) and I only feel the need to switch these out once or twice a year. The extra cost over a cheaper set is definitely worth it in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Buzzing string after 1 week
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these strings about a week ago and I put them on my acoustic guitar the minute they arrived. Now, I have noticed a buzzing from the G string! Previously I have purchased the Nanoweb strings from Elixir and those would last for up to 2 and a half months! I do not play with a heavy strum and the string is doing this already....? Definitely something wrong here. I would NOT buy this product again!
customer_reviews.author: Dove S.

customer_reviews.title: Coated, Bright
customer_reviews.text: I used to use Elixers back in the day (late 90s, early 2000s). I moved away from them for a long time. I decided to try them again. They sound exactly like what I remember. They are bright. Is that a bad thing? Not always. Is that a good thing? Not always. If you don't use Elixers and want a brighter sound get them.... If you like coated strings. With the coated strings, sometimes my finger will slide right off the string. Maybe it's something I need to get used to - But I don't want to get used to that. But it is nice to have strings that last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny C

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Mistakes - BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.text: So I buy strings a couple of times a year and I love these strings - when they came in they looked right at first glance and you can see they have these labeled as the Custom Lights (The only guage I can play with my arthritic hands) which are .011-.052 - but guess what? Amazon labeled the WRONG PACKAGE!!! Look at the side of the box: 13 - 53 - EPIC FAIL. And it came with another box of the CORRECT strings. These are unopened, but do you think they will exchange them since it was several months since I purchased them?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sound is every thing
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten back into playing guitar in the last couple of years and tried several brands of string (I just thought they were all the same) then I tried these strings and was hooked on them. I recently bought a new guitar that came with what was suppose to be good strings. I thought I had made an expensive mistake. My new guitar (an acoustic electric) had no volume when playing strictly acoustic I was ready to send it back when I thought what the heck I will try replacing the strings. So I put on the Elixir strings and what a difference, I love these strings
customer_reviews.author: Dave Dunning

customer_reviews.title: No stretch; try 'em.
customer_reviews.text: These will stay in tune like nothing I've found, once they're broken in. I can pick up an instrument two weeks after tuning it and it will still be very close. The guitar might move with humidity changes, but these are mostly constant. My local guitar store uses these on all their acoustic guitars. The sales people used to spend an hour each day tuning all the guitars before they opened. They sound great; excellent sustain and tone.
customer_reviews.author: Moburner

customer_reviews.title: Loud, bright and full.
customer_reviews.text: The price is what it is and the only con. I usually play Martin strings, but these strings feel & sound killer on my Martin 000. If you have a dark or muddy guitar these will brighten it up. Adds good volume, play great and very smooth. Depending on how much you play the strings have very good life. These are the only strings I buy. If you're playing a dreadnought, you may want a less bright string.
customer_reviews.author: John Halsey

customer_reviews.title: Too bright for me.
customer_reviews.text: Elixirs are great strings and they will outast most other brands. I have been playing elixirs for at least 15 years. I figured I will try the 80/20 since they were cheaper this to around. I have never tried these before. For me these are too bright on my Taylor 314. I feel like I lost the booming bass end of my guitar. Feels thin now. I will be going back to the phosphor bronze strings. If you want brighter then look no longer.
customer_reviews.author: Colt and Missy

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous sound, but coating frays easily.
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second set of strings in the last few months, and I've enjoyed their crisp sound. However, I notice that the D and G strings tend to fray where they are being picked. This may be caused by the fact that I primarily play fingerstyle. Personally it does not cause issues, but this is something to consider!
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: BEST STRINGS. PERIOD.
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST STRINGS I have ever played with on an acoustic guitar. Bright, but still warm. Clear and clean sound. Feels great. Smooth. I can't get over how good these strings are. If there are better strings than these, let me know because the only way they'd be better is if they were made from angel hair.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelino Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Really bright sounding strings.
customer_reviews.text: I thought the coating thing was a gimmick but these strings sound great after 10 months! Usually my strings sound good for about 3 weeks before they start sounding a bit dull but these are incredible. They might sound a little too bright for some if you are not used to them but I need all the help I can get for my 36 year old Yamaha FG 312. They were cheaper than the strings at the local music shop.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hxxxxxx7

customer_reviews.title: Metallic twang, also fret buzz and tuning issues
customer_reviews.text: Do not like the sound of these strings at all. Have a very bright metallic sound to them. Also, suddenly I have problems with fret and string buzz where I didn't before with the Martin strings I was using. My guess is people initially like the brightness and loudness of these strings. I find they are little too susceptible to various sour sounds, sound like metallic ringing strings, where I like a well-blended smooth sound. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Less than an hour.... "Break"
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me? This is the worst of the worst! I've got no use for this, just enjoying the sound... snap! HUH? Well, I've got my other guitar with 6 month old strings... still plays, dull but plays. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Motv8ed

customer_reviews.title: Masters of tone
customer_reviews.text: These strings replaced some rather old and grungy strings on my guitar. They were probably 8 or 9 years old and the guitar sounded terrible and it was a nightmare to play. So I ordered some Elixer strings (my go-to for electric) and all I can say is wow. This guitar actually sounds good now. I wish I could explain it better, but please just take my word for it. These are incredibly well designed and well made strings. The tone they create is second to none and the way they feel while playing is just incredible. I will not be buying anything except for Elixers for my acoustic now, too.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Great product, last 2 shipments sucked
customer_reviews.text: It pains me to leave a 4 star review. They’re a 5-star product. I’ve been using Elixir 80/20 for at least a decade. However, my last two shipments...there’s been one or two strings that have been bent. This is very uncharacteristic from them, but at the same time, not ok...Sound, quality and duration of the strings (minus the bent ones) have all been amazing. I’ll continue to buy from them, I just hope that I don’t receive anymore bent strings.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Horrible strings, extremely disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these strings because of the product's high Amazon rating. I'm not sure if the package I got was just defective, but the strings I received were a disaster. One string (the G) arrived with a small kink. I thought it would straighten out as I strung the guitar but it snapped before it was even close to reaching the G note. One week later, the sixth string (E) snapped on me during tuning. I would have been much better off trekking to my local guitar store and actually getting decent strings the first time around.
customer_reviews.author: J. M.

customer_reviews.title: Very good product  I do recommend them!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these string for a long time I love em. Ignore the bs about they’re coated strings they don’t sound as good, not true if you’re an older player and you’re hands hurt a little you may want to try these strings. If you’re an older beginner you do need these strings they’re easier and smoother to play on and for anybody playing theirs a lot less finger squeaks.
customer_reviews.author: william h.

customer_reviews.title: Different than than phosphor bronze.
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a 12-fret guitar which has a more mellow sound than I've become accustomed to with my 14-fret dreadnoughts. I wanted to brighten up the sound on the 12-fret, so I switched from Elixir's phosphor bronze to these 80/20s. Bingo! Bottom line: 80/20s have a brighter sound than phosphor bronze. Which one is best depends on the sound that you're after. Also, I prefer the nanowebs over the polywebs. To me they are the perfect balance between the heavier polyweb coating and regular uncoated strings. The nanowebs are slick, but not too slick.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Fake
customer_reviews.text: For disclosure I've played Elixir strings for 14 years. Elixir makes great strings and highly recommend them. However after receiving a set I ordered from Amazon on July 1st, 2020, I realized huge differences in the strings I removed and the new set I got from Amazon. Both are supposed to be Elixir 80/20 nanoweb. The new set does not have the nanoweb coating. The string even looks different in color from the real Elixir string and the wrap at the ball end is not of Elixir quality. These are obviously not real Elixir strings. Again I highly recommend Elixir strings but do not order from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: David Cromer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing better
customer_reviews.text: I have two high-end acoustic guitars, an original-series Ovation Balladeer and a hand-made acoustic with a sound similar to a D35, and I haven't used anything but Elixirs on them for a decade. They keep the Ovation bright and cutting, and they maintain the resonance of the other guitar. They really stand out when I go drop-D on the hand-crafted axe.
customer_reviews.author: Another Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: 80/20 C●@T€D
customer_reviews.text: These are hands down the best sounding strings I've heard, from the alloy to the coating they are good in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: I took a step into the unfamiliar and got this extra light gauge strings when I'm use to heavy. I've gotten to where I like to solo more and play bends so I thought I'd try these out. I LOVE them. So bright. So much tone to these. They feel so natural and smooth under my fingers. I've been using these for a few weeks now and they still have great tone.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Ray.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, and well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I made the switch to Elixir strings a few years ago on my brother's recommendation, and I haven't gone back since. Getting 3 for the price of two is great, because even with these suckers I still burn through a set of strings in about a month and a half. I'm still trying to decide if I like the Nanoweb over the Polyweb, but they're both really great regardless. Will definitely continue to buy these strings in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Gassaway

customer_reviews.title: BEST GUITAR STRINGS EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Here's the real deal guys! I have been playing the guitar for over 65 years. I have tried several different strings over the years. But when I bought a Taylor guitar that came with the Elixir Strings I knew I had finally found the right strings for me. They are bright, amazing sustain, easy to play, and last for months. Yes! A little pricey but well worth the extra money. The strings I used to use after 2 or 3 weeks would go dead. I don't know about you but I don't like changing strings. These strings to me are the best ever!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Liptow

customer_reviews.title: No Ballbearing on “B” string
customer_reviews.text: The “B” string didn’t come complete with the ballbearing to sit in the bridge. Had to reuse the old string to continue playing.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Kraft

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait to try these? I'll never go back!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't understand why the guitarists from my band always swore by Elixir string. Being a beginner-intermediate guitarist myself, I always aimed at reasonably priced strings. That was until I tried these. The difference is evident and the durability is superior to any other I have tried. If you take good care of them, they will sound and last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Y. A-P.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best sound but lasts long time with good enough sound.
customer_reviews.text: I like metallic sound of 80/20, and I usually like John Pearse strings. However, John Pearse strings lose their "new" sound quickly, so I tried Elixir on my 1995 Takamine with Cedar top because Elixir sounds pretty nice on my Taylor GS Mini Koa. Initially, the strings sounded so "plasticky", and I was really disappointed. However, after a week of playing, it started sounding pretty good (still has a little bit of unnatural "plasticky" sound). Not sure whether the strings stretched out for better sound or my ears became used to that sound. Still not my ideal sound, but good enough and lasts long time.
customer_reviews.author: Sunnyman

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed! No strings in package, not one!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these a year ago in a lot of 3 sets. Finally got to the last set of gutair strings while at a performance today, but disappointment stuck when I opened the box to find that each and every envelope was empty, not one string in the entire package, show for me was over, super disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: John L. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Top notch
customer_reviews.text: Been a fan of Elixir since the first time I discovered them. Very durable strings that are bound to last several years of use. One of my favorite things about these strings is that they maintain their color and their rich tone long after many have long lost their luster and their sound muddied. I'll never put a different brand of strings on my guitars ever again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Impossible To Choose Just One!
customer_reviews.text: I am a devout Taylor enthusiast... And they have it exactly right using Elixirs... My Grand Acoustic 914ce came with Light Nanowebs... And they are a dream to listen to and play. For me, I like to change my strings often between the Light Nanowebs, the Mediums, and the Phospor Bronze regularly. To me it's as good as having 3 different 914ce's. Something pretty exquisite that Elixirs offer that simply no other string can in both their handling and richness of tone. I find the Phosphors have a deeper soul to their sound... which I really love. Any Elixir string is a phonemonon all of it's own and you simply can't go wrong with any.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Lost tone!!
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't write negative reviews but this time was necessary. I have an alvarez artist series acoustic guitar which came from factory with d'addario exp strings. I in the past loved elixir strings but on this paticular model guitar they sound terrible. I lost all the tone and playability that i loved. These strings sound hollow and tinny. I found that I have to press extra hard to prevent buzzing and open chords sound distorted and disharmonious. I literally can't stand to play it until I get new strings. For this particular guitar these were a bad choice. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Timelessswagg

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and soft to the touch! So says my Seagull.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great. So light and round when needed and powerful too. I finger pick and they feel great, this coming from a newbie. Just getting my calluses. Gave old strings to some homeless guitar player. Can't wait to get some playing under my belt so that I can pass these on to some homeless guy who probably will make the old strings sound better than me when they were new. Lol😆
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Strings to live by!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone knows why Elixir strings are so popular, and why they have a (slightly) premium price tag. But to the guy that believes in quality > quantity, these are strings to live by. They won't go dead after your 1 set, so you'll probably save some cash in the long run. To the guy that has sweaty hands, strings won't corrode, which is a huge seller! And if you're rough on the guitar, the coating will not peel off! Well, unless you try to force it off somehow. Been using Elixirs for the past 10 years (for your electric guitar players, definitely try out the Optiweb coating), and will not switch out!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Lasts forever
customer_reviews.text: I don't change strings often, so I love these strings. It seems they stay smooth forever and never corrode. They do lose brightness though. I've never broken a string but the round wound broke on the G string after like 5 years (but was still playable). Compared to the Ernie Balls i use on my electrics, these are worth the extra $. You can likely cut down your string changes by 3x.
customer_reviews.author: Dozer The Cat

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This is bullcrap!! I've been buying these for years and bragging on them being the best and this order was pathetic! My guitar is always in the case when not being played and they look ten years old already!! Must be the defective products they send to this company for cheap for resale. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: troy

customer_reviews.title: Great string most of the time
customer_reviews.text: Never found a string that compares. I don't change my strings every week or every month for that matter. Always regret purchasing other strings since. Simply the best for me. Great sound for long time. Still play great when they are all beat up and old. Never had a bad string. Can't say the same for the EB's I just bought in a pinch a while back. Guitar player, ex string maker, ex other String brand trier-outer. Update: Last set had a bad string. A very bad string. It was dead and dull and differed in colour than the other wound strings. I'm dropping a star. A visual inspection would of caught this easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Elixer mediums....Do it!!!
customer_reviews.text: First time I have used elixirs. For the money they have outdid any other strings I have tried in quality and price. The vibration is absolutely amazing. Vibrated so beautifully it had me thinking it wasnt normal lol. Sounded so heavenly I thought I better stop before I summon a crew of angles down from heaven!!
customer_reviews.author: rroswell1

customer_reviews.title: Best Sounding Guitar Strings I Have Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing guitar for over 50 years and I have a good ear for tone quality. I was searching for strings for my Taylor acoustic guitar. I was told to try Elixir. I finally got the sound that I have been searching a long time for. They are a perfect for my Taylor Guitar.I give them 5 stars for quality and sound
customer_reviews.author: William Jones

customer_reviews.title: nice tone, but g-string breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Bought these strings because my d'addario's wore out completely at the frets within a few months. So I bought these, thinking they would last longer. I strung my guitar, and the g string snapped while doing a routine string stretch. The tone is very nice. However, seems g-string breakage is a huge problem with these, as a google search of "elixir g-string break" came back with many forums of users complaining of this issue. So stretch and pluck that G-string gently! Off to Victoria's Secret and pick up a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Garry B Sears

customer_reviews.title: Consider Switching to These Strings
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time to use these strings. I was interested in them because I play my acoustic sporadically so my strings don't wear out, so much as they age out. I usually have to change them for the sake of tone, not because of physical wear or stretch. As such, the idea of a coated string was appealling. So far, I'm happy with them. The tone was nice and bright, and has been consistent over the few months I've had them on. As a bonus, you don't seem to get that metallic smell on your fingers that some strings leave.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: I love the sound and feel of these strings
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound and feel of these strings. I would like a replacement G string as it broke as I was tightening the strings before it was even in tune. I ordered a replacement and they sent a whole set. Lucky I save do the old strings. I wish there was away to tell Amazon you need a replacement string instead of them say you want to return the entire package. Anyway these strings are great with less finger buzzing and easy to play.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: don't buy these
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a couple of of months so can't return. Put them on tonight. Started tuning with a pitch pipe to e on my lowest string. Didn't get close when the winding broke. Not string-- the winding!!! WTF. Expensive mistake I won't make again. Back to D'Addario-- they never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca wallace

customer_reviews.title: strings
customer_reviews.text: The item was received in good condition. Packaging could not have been improved on. I was satisfy with the item and it performed as expected and as advertise. I would Recommend the item and would order it again. For the price you could not get a Better deal.
customer_reviews.author: SEABEE

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Acoustic Guitar Strings (For those who don't like to change them often)
customer_reviews.text: These Elixir guitar strings are excellent. The coating allows them to last for a very long time (mine have been used for about 8 months with frequent use) and they stay in tune very well. I like to strum hard, and these strings never fail. At first, the strings may feel greasy or oily, but the coating will adhere to the strings better after a bit of play. After a while, the coating will start to wear off where you strum, and it will look like dust. These strings are excellent and the higher price was worth every penny, as these strings have lasted for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Long life new string sound
customer_reviews.text: This was my first set of Elixir strings and I probably will stay with them. I have about 40 hours on the current set and, while I wasn't overly impressed with them initially, they seem to get better with use. They are very bright and still maintain the new string sound. Give them a week before making your decision. I put these on my new Seagull S6 cedar top.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R.

customer_reviews.title: Great acoustic strings for bright sound
customer_reviews.text: This set of strings is great. I really like Elixir strings. The set sounds really really bright. Even the bass strings have this very metallic ring to it that I really like. If I were to nit pick, low E string sounds weird and too rounded when you hit its harmonics. It loses the bright metallic ring that I really like about these strings. Other than that, it sounds really really great.
customer_reviews.author: HeyoPrinsen

customer_reviews.title: Great tonal quality and longevity
customer_reviews.text: Great HD strings. As a full time musician, I play on these everyday. They do keep their brightness a lot longer then what the nano coating lasts. I usually change the full set every 2-3 weeks playing every day. especially in warm humid weather. Elixir HD 80/20 NANO COATED strings are the only strings I use on my Taylor.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Coating comes off quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I really loved the tone of these out of the box except the low E string, which lacked brightness. After about a week of use, the coating started coming off where I strum the guitar. Also don’t like that they use fluoroplymer coating. This is bad for the environment.
customer_reviews.author: J-man

customer_reviews.title: Great strings!
customer_reviews.text: In my experience, Elixir strings are the only ones that can resist the perspiration from my hands. I use medium gauge strings and play bluegrass rhythm. There's no way I could even come close to the playing of Billy Strings or Josh Williams, but for me these strings seem to last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Bellevue Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great strings!
customer_reviews.text: I love the way these strings sound, especially on my Seagull S6 original. This is the sound I've been looking for; clear, bright and sustained. I can't imagine a better tone... The feel of these strings is great. They're smooth and relatively quiet. Some say the coating muffles the tonal quality. I don't hear that at all. I also like the way the tension feels under my fingers- firm, (not rigid), with just the right amount of give. I highly recommend these Elixir Nanowebs for a well-balanced, bright and clear tone.
customer_reviews.author: warbler

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite strings
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try new strings and these are amazing. Such a nice full bodied warm sound, and smooth strings are easier on the fingers than my old ones. I paid a little more than I usually would for these strings but they were worth every penny, so far they've outlasted other strings I've had too.
customer_reviews.author: Seth W

customer_reviews.title: Bright sound and long-lasting
customer_reviews.text: They last a long time. I feel they are quite bright. I don't have them on all of my guitars, but like them where I have them. They are a bit expensive. My other favorite strings are about $5.00 dollars less. Yet I still use these where I want that sound.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie James Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Mixed gauge string sets are the best of both worlds
customer_reviews.text: Mixed gauge string sets are the best of both worlds! Nanowebs work well. Like most things guitar related, sound and tone is subjective. People get caught up in these wars arguing about which strings sound better. Go with whatever sounds good to YOUR ears. To my ears...elixirs work well and last a long time. That's all I need to know.
customer_reviews.author: 21days

customer_reviews.title: Best strings for personal, occasional, commercial guitar playing.
customer_reviews.text: As a Guitarist, I never liked using new strings. Even I don't know why I don't like new strings. This changed with the Elixir Light Guage. I fell in love with these strings on my first strum. The reason I went for it was because I researched the type of strings Ed Sheeran uses and found out it was the Elixir light Guage, so I decided to give it a try, and that's by far the best decision I've ever made on strings. It's just the best. P.S did I mention that I've been bouncing back and forth from different brands of strings?
customer_reviews.author: Larry Olusegun

customer_reviews.title: BEST acoustic strings I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always purchased d’addario phosphor bronze ej16 strings and that is what I used for over a decade. I decided to splurge on these and I couldn’t believe how much better they are. The strings sound brand new about 10x longer than my Oldboy strings and they feel good under the fingers. It’s astonishing how much of a difference a good set of strings make. Try these before upgrading your guitar
customer_reviews.author: mitchell1

customer_reviews.title: Good Strings but one snapped right away
customer_reviews.text: I got these strings today and I've been playing with them and I love the sounds they make and it give my guitar a much more vibrant feel and sound. My only issue was that my B string broke off when there was little to no tension on it. I would've understood it breaking if I tightened it to much but I had it set and as soon as i turned it to start tightening it broke off near the tuning pegs. Aside from this issue though I love the strings and it was the only thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Uriah M

customer_reviews.title: Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even get to the tuning stage of the D string and broke it. I've been stringing my guitar for 20 now and never broke the D string. Also have used elixir strings for years never had a problem. Maybe it's like everything else in the world being made cheap, or maybe it's like a lot of things on Amazon bootlegged and put in the rapper. I will be going to my local guitar shop from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A Marraccini

customer_reviews.title: They're brilliant. In my guitar ( jumbo / dreadnought ) ...
customer_reviews.text: Last time I had Elixirs on my Gibson CL-40 was in the 90's when they came in one flavor, no "nano" or "poly" so I had to trust reviews this time round. They're brilliant. In my guitar ( jumbo / dreadnought ) the bass is full and a little punchy , mids are articulate and well rounded and while the highs aren't as crystal as other strings I've tried, the overall blend is so nice I don't miss giving up a little treble.
customer_reviews.author: GoofyFoot

customer_reviews.title: Tested many strings these are great strings-
customer_reviews.text: Extra light and Custom lights are just TO THIN. Good for soft play sounding wonderful in a small room. But to soft, can not get any volume,, strings start bending to much. Kinda slippery. Great for sliding up and down though. I REALLY like the LIGHTS. I suppose I'll move on to medium soon. That's what the 20 ++ year players like. They say more fuller sound. The lights are nice and clear. // I do wear these out in one month though. I'm sticking with Elixir LIGHTS. (the strings all sing together nicely) I play 3 hours a day. Is that to much?? UPDATE-- The 80/20s have WAY BETTER TONE
customer_reviews.author: electro freak

customer_reviews.title: Tone similar to GHS Boomers (electric strings), but they ...
customer_reviews.text: Tone similar to GHS Boomers (electric strings), but they last freaking forever. If you're a casual player (or put them on one of your less-frequently played guitars), and you clean your strings/neck after every session, it's not unusual to get a year out of these things. The plain steel B- and E-strings usually corrode LONG before the coated wound strings. Eventually (before the apocalypse, but sometime after it snows in hell), the nanoweb coating will flake off in select areas, especially if you make judicious use of hard or stiff picks, but they're surprisingly durable for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for players with sweaty hands!
customer_reviews.text: What can i say, these are pretty much the best strings out there in coated strings. I have used them off and on for 13-14 years and I love how long they last. My hands can get pretty sweaty sometimes when I play and can leave ordinary strings fairly dirty even just after 1 day after having changed them. Not with Elixers, and at the low price they are on Amazon I will absolutely be buying them through here from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Orozco

customer_reviews.title: Simply Great
customer_reviews.text: I used these guitar strings on my daughter's guitar in Nov. of 2017. Granted lite but regular use, these guitar strings are only now beginning to show wear. Also, found the Extra Light strings to be perfect for a beginner. And they sound great. Great strings overall!
customer_reviews.author: Dave A.

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with the tone nor the flaking after one week of playing .
customer_reviews.text: There are those that love coated strings and those that don't so this is just my opinion. I put a set of these on my vintage Ovation. These strings sound coated and the Martin SP's I was using sound so much better. Plus after just one week of play there's material flaking off the strings. If you want a really good sounding acoustic string that's treated to last month to 3 months that doesn't have a coated string then try Martin Lifespan's. I love Lifespan but won't be buying anymore Elixirs.
customer_reviews.author: Ecstrat

customer_reviews.title: Awesome strings!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome strings!! They last a long time, stay in tune, and sound incredible! Smooth to the touch with a very minor wound feel. Try them, you will love them. For a brighter tone, try the 80/20’s! They are awesome as well!
customer_reviews.author: Drvajeep

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend these.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice guitar player with a cheap fender acoustic. I've always thought that my guitar sounded nice enough for no better than I am at playing it. But I broke the high E and decided on these strings. I got to say, I'm very disappointed in the sound. Maybe it's because they're light strings? I really don't know. But they sound very, very pingy if that makes sense. Very metallic sounding. Maybe all light strings sound this way. I'll try something else next time.
customer_reviews.author: PachlB

customer_reviews.title: Easy on fingers!
customer_reviews.text: My husband recommends due to the fact these are really light weight and do not hurt your fingers. These are a game changer from his original strings, which were not bad either, but he took a few years off playing and needs to build up calluses again.
customer_reviews.author: The Walls Household

customer_reviews.title: Moved on from these.
customer_reviews.text: Sound really good. But after a month or more the coating starts to fray where ur pick hits em. Also the windings on the G ALWAYS separate. I now use Daddario coated. They last longer bc these 2 things don't happen. Think Elx are coated after they are wound vs the Ds which are coated before being wound.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie L.

customer_reviews.title: Would not use any other type of strings on any of my guitars.
customer_reviews.text: My guitar sounds so much better with these strings as compared to so of the others on the market. The longevity is amazing. I generally play 3 or more time a week for at least 1 hour or more and they last at lease 2-2/12 months before sounding a bit worn.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Broke While Tuning
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product since I’ve purchased some strings before, however, unfortunately while replacing and tuning the D or 3rd string, it snapped, I was confused since it wasn’t even under much tension and guitar strings should hold tension for a while. It is unfortunate :/ maybe it was a defective string?
customer_reviews.author: Bros of NP

customer_reviews.title: but still sound great. The originals were too hard
customer_reviews.text: Replaced stock strings on my Gibson Hummingbird Pro with these (one of the originals broke). These are much easier on fingers, but still sound great. The originals were too hard, couldn't play long, these made a real difference. If I knew that I would replace strings on day one as I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: SergeiS

customer_reviews.title: They stay in tune
customer_reviews.text: I was beginning to think that my playing was getting worse or my hearing. I was always playing with the tuners. I've been using these strings for a couple of weeks now and I hardly touch the tuning. The sound is bright and not too loud but I would like to see the lower strings sound a little less tinny. Still, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Just For You

customer_reviews.title: Keeps tone well, but coating comes off quick
customer_reviews.text: Strings offer great tone, and the tone is long lasting. Have had the strings on for 3 weeks, and the coating is starting to wear off on the D and G strings when using a flat pick. Strings still have their tone which is good. For fingerpicking, I can recommend. For using picks, I don't recommend. Maybe if it lasted 2 months before the coating started coming off, then I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Maneke

customer_reviews.title: Awesome price for such great strings
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these strings for years but quit buying them a while back because they were expensive everywhere they were sold. Finally I found them here at a great price. The strings are coated that allows your fingers to slide easier with taking chunks out of your finger tips. Makes it a lot easier to clean as well. The sound is better than any other strings I've used before. They tend to last about 3 times longer than others. Only strings I'll use from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these strings to restring my guitar that I havent touched in over 7 years. They were easy to put on and the tones are beautiful. I'm definitely happy with my purchase and will definitely try to look for electric strings.
customer_reviews.author: GracieLyn

customer_reviews.title: Last long like your mom
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars for sound. 5 stars for sounding good for an eternity. Okay, months! Unlike strings without the nanoweb, in my opinion, these strings take a couple days before sounding their best. When you put them on initially before that web has been broken down a little, they are not quite right. That changes after a little playing and they stay that way for a long while.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hurd

customer_reviews.title: The best sound requires the best strings.......ELIXIR
customer_reviews.text: Top of the line strings no doubt!!! I play every week and some weeks every day. Not professionally. With the elixir strings they stay in tune and I change them every 18-20 months. When I change them they still sound good. My internal clock goes off and I change them. I have Elixirs on my Taylor 714ce, Martin D16RGT, Fender Lead I Electric, and Fender Acoustic. I won't compromise on my strings, it's the most important component on the guitar.
customer_reviews.author: daniel nix

customer_reviews.title: WHat I once thought was a good product, now I will never purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these strings because I have used Elixir strings in the past and appreciated the sound and the longevity. These are horrible. I had intended to give a package to one of my uncles but decided to wait until I had played with them for a while. Glad I did. The crispness of the sound deteriorated quickly leading to earlier change of strings. The second set of strings aren't worth a damn. I've taken them off and put on the third set and am less impressed than ever. Can't wait for the music stores to reopen so I can go back to Martin strings.
customer_reviews.author: Doug C.

customer_reviews.title: Elixir Fan
customer_reviews.text: I play mostly rhythm guitar and some light picking for our church worship team. Like the brightness and durability of Elixir strings. I just stay with what I like and know works for me and look for the best deals.
customer_reviews.author: The T's

customer_reviews.title: Elixir - What else more is there to say
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest price I could find when I purchased these. I have owned guitars from Martins to Taylor’s to Breedlove and putting on the right strings is crucial. Love Elixir strings and these definitely did not disappoint. Bright and easy to slide fingers across.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Ko

customer_reviews.title: This type of string is perfect for my Alvarez acoustic guitar
customer_reviews.text: This type of string is perfect for my Alvarez acoustic guitar. As usual, the strings are packaged into envelopes depending on the size of the string. I've used this brand of string several times in the past, and they really do continue ringing longer than most. I play occasionally at home. This brand and weight has been highly recommended by several professional players I have encountered -- with good reason.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Albers

customer_reviews.title: This is the best acoustic guitar string I have used
customer_reviews.text: This is the best acoustic guitar string I have used! I have been playing guitar for almost 10 years now and so far this guitar string showed the longest life compared to the other brands out there in the market. The longest one for me was over a year, but that involves constant cleaning after each use. I've been recommending it to my fellow guitarist friends and they share the same opinion with me. This is the only string that I buy now and I don't think I will be changing brands again unless there's another one better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Noel A.

customer_reviews.title: Love the protective coating
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the strings, not only do they look good they play as smooth as silk! The tone is great, not to bright and they don’t have that tingy sound some phosphorus bronze strings have! I’ll definitely be ordering more of them!! For the price I think these strings are a steal!!
customer_reviews.author: David D

customer_reviews.title: Low E string broke while restringing
customer_reviews.text: While restringing the guitar the Low E string broke for no apparent reason, had to dig into my trash to find my old E string to put on my guitar , Geez!, next time I should order the Light tension instead of the Custom Light, maybe that will help, but these new strings sounds good, and easy on the fingers, so far, we'll see if they hold tune, ....all 5 of them .
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Rubi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Packaging around Trash Strings
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get these. They are beautiful gold strings like that of an angel. But when I played my first song it sounded like a Martin guitar had a pillow shoved inside. No brightness. I’ve been playing guitar for 29 years and this was the most upsetting restring of my life. Straight garbajo.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great Strings
customer_reviews.text: Use these 100% of the time on my acoustic now. For years actually. There is a slight trade off using coated but the amount of time they last and last and last far exceeds any non-coated strings. My non-coated string days are behind me. Oh, and these are the best! Don't try others. Get these. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Best Brand Money Can Buy
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, sound is subjective but I REALLY love Elixirs. If you have a cheap guitar that sounds awful, try these. If you get annoyed with the sound your fingers make when moving around the fretboard, try these. If you hate changing your stings everytime you turn around, try these. After you play them for awhile, you'll find it very hard to go back to plain old normal strings. It's worth it. I've been playing for over twenty years now and I've used them for nearly all this time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: Best strings I've EVER used
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best strings I've ever used. Nice and bright, but they also have decent low end, and aren't at all hard to get volume with. I play live plugged into a pa every week and they sound great. Right now I'm almost 5 months in with this set, and they still feel and sound very close to new. The feel of them is very smooth and easy to play because their coating. I've been using only these for almost years. They may be more expenseve, but very well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Callie E. Littlefield

customer_reviews.title: Sound nice but...
customer_reviews.text: These really sound nice--very bright which I like. However they are very "squeaky" which i know many people don't mind but it's not my preference. Also they fall out of tune more than I"m used to with modern coated strings--but that's a minor complaint. I probably wouldn't get them again as there are better options IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Jonmarr

customer_reviews.title: Stopped peeling finger tips; great sound, durability
customer_reviews.text: So good. Found these years ago as a solution to peeling finger tips: My skin was reacting to oxidizing strings. Elixirs weren't popular at the time, hard to find, and were cheap (& my fingers stopped peeling). I was worried that they would not be popular enough to survive. I bought a whole bunch. Now they are well-known ...and not cheap. They sound great, last a very long time, and beat out other strings that were highly recommended (sound, playability). So all around, a great solution for me.
customer_reviews.author: K. C.

customer_reviews.title: Awful sound.
customer_reviews.text: These came highly rated but their sound was worse than any strings I've ever used. They sounded so extremely twangy and bright. It took 6+ months and rubbing them with greece to reduce the twangyness by 60 percent. They still sound like some weird honky-tonk piano or something. It's that sound like if you strum the strings right next to the bridge, except they always sound like that. Gross...
customer_reviews.author: J. Welin

product_meta.title: Elixir Strings 80/20 Bronze Acoustic Guitar Strings w NANOWEB Coating, Light (.012-.053)
product_meta.description: Size:Light (.012-.053)| Style:Single SetProlong your tone with the same acoustic guitar strings that experienced players worldwide trust to keep their incredible tone longer than any other string available. Unlike other string brands, Elixir Strings coats the whole string. This protects not only the outer string surface but also the gaps between the windings where common tone-deadening gunk typically builds up in other brands’ coated and uncoated guitar strings. Anti-Rust Plating on plain steel strings ensures longer tone life for the entire set. Who wouldn’t love more quality playing time between the hassle and cost of string changes? Premium by design, these acoustic strings constructed with 80/20 (80% copper, 20% zinc) bronze wrap wire boast a crisp, bright tone with an expressive, vibrant presence. Compared to our original POLYWEB Coating, the ultra-thin NANOWEB Coating allows a more traditionally textured, “uncoated” feel. For a slicker, gentler feel, try the original POLYWEB Coating on our 80/20 Bronze Acoustic Strings, which also feature a more robust and rounded tone. For more of a balance between bold and bright, our Phosphor Bronze Acoustic Guitar Strings with NANOWEB Coating deliver full-bodied tone and sparkling high-end clarity alongside the same traditional feel as these 80/20 bronze strings. Of course, the kind of string you play is all a matter of personal preference. Not sure what tone or feel is right for you? Try them out for yourself, and find your new favorite string from Elixir Strings. For a more in-depth look at what makes our strings so special, scroll to the branded info further down the page. Elixir Strings: Great tone. Long life.
feature_bullets: Acoustic guitar strings constructed with 80/20 (80% copper, 20% zinc) bronze wrap wire
Played for a crisp, bright tone with an expressive, vibrant presence
Ultra-thin NANOWEB Coating provides a more traditionally textured, “uncoated” feel
Our patented coating technology protects against common corrosion, extending tone life longer than any other brand’s coated or uncoated strings (Elixir Strings player survey)

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars9,012 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
